items.name: Paragraph
items.label:
UASIMAP for self-reflection tool

This self-reflection tool will enable UAS to measure (or better to map) their engagement activities and contributions to regions, and the results and impact on the local economy including public and private sector stakeholders. 

The tool is intended to support internal QA assurance of UAS and, therefore, complement use of the European Standards and Guidelines for quality assurance by addressing teaching, learning and research (and other dimensions) as relevant to regional engagement.

The tool captures the multidimensional nature of regional engagement of UAS and will contribute to the critical evaluation of this engagement.

In order to do so four dimensions will be assessed:

  1. Providing Capacity for Regional Strategy Development;
  2. Developing Talents, Skills and Competencies reflecting Regional Needs and Opportunities;
  3. Promoting Regional Development through User-inspired Research, Development and Innovation;
  4. Enhancing Social, Civic and Cultural Activities of the Regions’ Community.

 

Instructions for using the tool:

Each of those dimensions will be evaluated using a set of subdimensions, which have associated a collection of questions you should answer rating their level of achievement in your organization. In addition you will be asked to provide the rationale behind your answers in terms of influencing factors, facts and evidences of those achievements. 
The section Help will provide you with all details about each of the four dimensions and examples of the level of achievement you can use as reference for completing the questionnaire.  You will have access to each Dimension help page from the questions addressing each Dimension.

As soon as you will finish answering all questions, a report page will be generated and you can download it for analysing the results and find ways in which the UAS can improve its regional engagement.

items.name: Dimension I.1 intro Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION I PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
I.1. Embedding the regional role and dimension in the UAS mission, strategies and leadership

Strategies, policies, structures and mechanisms to leverage the UAS institutional knowledge, capacity and resources for local and regional development and to create a culture of engagement between the UAS and its region, including its public, private and third sector actors and the wider population.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level of achievement while 5 is the highest.

items.name: Dim I.1 Radio grid input
items.label: I.1. Embedding the regional role and dimension in the UAS mission, strategies and leadership. To what extend

optionsHorizontal.id: I.1.1. does the UAS mission and strategy/-ies promote regional engagement?
optionsHorizontal.name: I.1.1. does the UAS mission and strategy/-ies promote regional engagement?

optionsHorizontal.id: I.1.2 is the regional role and engagement of the UAS embedded through specific responsibilities of senior staff?
optionsHorizontal.name: I.1.2 is the regional role and engagement of the UAS embedded through specific responsibilities of senior staff?

items.name: Dim I.1 Rationale_Textarea input
items.label: What factors informed your responses? (optional additional information / evidence used)

items.name: Dim I.1 EvidencesFile upload
items.label: If you have documents with evidences, please upload them here

items.name: Dim I.2 Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION I PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
I.2. Integrating the regional role and dimension in the UAS governance and organisation

The regional engagement of UAS from a strategical point of view should be systematized through different organisational units / structures. The UAS should carefully plan the level of resources which needed for regional engagement and should consider raising the motivation of different stakeholders and has a system for monitoring, evaluating and improvement of regional engagement activities.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

items.name: Dim I.2 Radio grid input
items.label: I.2. Integrating the regional role and dimension in the UAS governance and organisation. To what extent

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.1. are structures in place at institutional level to plan, coordinate and embed regional engagement?
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.1. are structures in place at institutional level to plan, coordinate and embed regional engagement?

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.2. do regional actors actively participate in committees / networks / structures of the UAS?
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.2. do regional actors actively participate in committees / networks / structures of the UAS?

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by students
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by students

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by staff
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by staff

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by stakeholders
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.3. are supports / incentives in place to encourage engagement with the region by stakeholders

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.4 do the regional role and dimension influence the commitment of resources, whether human, financial, space, infrastructure?
optionsHorizontal.name: I.2.4 do the regional role and dimension influence the commitment of resources, whether human, financial, space, infrastructure?

optionsHorizontal.id: I.2.5. are systems in place to monitor, report, evaluate and improve progress and achievements in this domain?

items.name: Dim I.3 Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION I PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
I.3 Valuing the regional role and engagement in the UAS staff policies

UAS staff play a key role in its regional engagement. UAS should consider regional engagement in recruitment, professional development and rewarding of its staff.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

items.name: Dim I.4 Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION I PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
I.4. Engaging in regional strategies, networks, partnerships, structures and bodies

UAS should be an active partner and/or member of key regional networks and bodies. UAS intellectual capital and experience should play an active role in regional development. UAS can be part of the process (but it could be limited based on national/regional legislation).

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

II.1. Offering study programmes in accordance with regional interests and opportunities

items.name: Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION II PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
II.3. Delivering programmes in partnership with regional actors

Explanation: This sub-dimension is focusing on the active participation of the regional actors in teaching and learning (including internships and work-based learning (WBL). Work-based learning is an educational strategy that provides students with real-life work experiences where they can apply academic and technical skills and develop their employability.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

DIMENSION II PROVIDING CAPACITY FOR REGIONAL STRATEGIES DEVELOPMENT
II.4. Supporting Lifelong Learning on the regional level

Explanation: Lifelong learning refers to further education provided to individuals and employers and may consist of reskilling and upskilling for labour market needs. It may be delivered through micro-credentials or entire study programmes.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

DIMENSION III PROMOTING REGIONS’ DEVELOPMENT THROUGH USER-INSPIRED RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
III.2. Providing expert capacity for regional actors’ development

Expert capacity means e.g. direct cooperation based on individual agreement(s) or expertise provided on basis of the framework agreement, (some) bachelor or diploma thesis are done on the topic required by regional actors (public, private or NGO´s) etc.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

III.3. Providing the regional actors with access to the UAS RDI / facilities and equipment

Facilities refers to any technical (laboratory, machines, science parks etc.), IT (VR, software) equipment, libraries etc. Offering these facilities can support regional industry development.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

III.4. Supporting outputs of regional RDI cooperation

Cooperation between UAS and regional actors generates outputs: Spin-offs, starts-ups, innovation centres, business incubators, fab-labs, research projects, entrepreneurial activities of staff & students, alumni activities, patents, practical publication.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

DIMENSION III PROMOTING REGIONS’ DEVELOPMENT THROUGH USER-INSPIRED RESEARCH AND INNOVATION
III.5. Promoting transfer of knowledge to and knowledge exchange with the region

Knowledge transfer can be organization of (international) conferences, workshops, events, publication (research) and popularization articles, publication of information on the website, social networks and in regional media, public events, (scientific) festivals.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

DIMENSION IV ENHANCING SOCIAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ACTIVITIES OF THE REGION’S COMMUNITY 
IV.1. Supporting community-engaged teaching and learning including credit-bearing curricular activities and students’ volunteering

Strategies, policies, practices and resources to implement, sustain and embed civic, social, cultural and community engagement as an institutional UAS activity.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

IV.2. Providing research, development and innovation to investigate and solutions to issues of public interest or concern

Explanation: This sub-dimension focuses on RDI which is non-commercial and has a focus on the interest of the general public regional and social issues and citizens interests.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

items.label:
DIMENSION IV ENHANCING SOCIAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ACTIVITIES OF THE REGION’S COMMUNITY 
IV.3. Leveraging institutional knowledge and resources for social good

Explanation: UAS is an institution that produces a lot of knowledge which can be used for regional well-being and social good. UAS also has many facilities and services which can serve regional communities and citizens.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

items.name: Dim IV.3 Radio grid input
items.label: IV.3. Leveraging institutional knowledge and resources for social good. To what extent

items.name: Dim IV.4 Paragraph
items.label:
DIMENSION IV ENHANCING SOCIAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ACTIVITIES OF THE REGION’S COMMUNITY 
IV.4. Building win-win systematic approaches to social, civic and community engagement

Explanation: UAS interaction with regional communities can build a win-win system for both sides.

You will find additional information about this Dimension and questions here

Remember when selecting the answers which better apply to your situation for the following questions: 1 represents the lowest level while 5 is the highest.

items.name: Dim IV.4 Radio grid input
items.label: IV.4. Building win-win systematic approaches to social, civic and community engagement. To what extent
